@jcinca1 Ain't that the truth! Have a splendid day. I send you a puff of peace mixed with solidarity, from the shores of the Mediterranean!
@jcinca1 Hehehe. Well you'll have to teach me from the inside. You're in politics. I'm just an armchair radical 😐🤣
@jcinca1 @POTUS44 We all miss him. All over the world. Not only for his actions but also his presence, elegance. A unique man
@jcinca1 We all seem to know what we don't like. Now we need to get together and build a consensus to decide what we do like & how to get it
@jcinca1 I don't think it too late. America still represents hope to many of us outside it. We need to unite worldwide now
@jcinca1 Maybe Trump and others of his ilk are what we need to mobilise, to get involved, work for change
@jcinca1 Guess it depends what we mean by the word revolution. Violent ones don't work. Social revolutions stemming from protest? Maybe?
@jcinca1 So, yeah, its attractive to talk about bringing systems down - but what follows is often worse. It's tricky!
@jcinca1 I spent years in LatAm and saw the chaos resulting from movements that overthrew one system completely replacing it with their own
@jcinca1 We need the non-political infrastructure-the civil service, if you like-non partisan professionals. What else do we need🤔?
@jcinca1 I will check him out, thanks! I'm with you on education but not necessarily the kind we have now...
@jcinca1 I don't personally believe that our systems (not limited to the US) are able or interested in supporting or protecting us
@jcinca1 Interesting comment about Greenwald. I don't know anything about him. But the system is broken belief doesn't stem from his tweet
